tool_description: Chartbeat collects various metrics about each visitor on your site. Some of this is reported basically raw (like number of readers on an article), and some data is mashed up and modified before being reported (like understanding that a visitor that c
name: Chartbeat
title: Chartbeat

api_list.name: Live Geo v3
api_list.description: Returns geographical information about the most recent visitors. This call returns sampled data.

required_parameters.name: host
required_parameters.description: The domain of the site you would like to query represented as a string.

required_parameters.name: jsonp
required_parameters.description: The name of a function to wrap the return data in.

required_parameters.name: path
required_parameters.description: A specific path. If not given, data is from all paths. e.g. the path of http://chartbeat.com/signup/ is /signup/.

required_parameters.name: limit
required_parameters.description: The max number of recent data to return. Default: 100.

api_list.name: Historical Engagement Series
api_list.description: Returns series of the engaged seconds where the default time span of each data point is 5 minutes. You should use this call if you want to see a more granular picture of your data.

required_parameters.name: jsonp
required_parameters.description: The name of a function to wrap the return data in.

required_parameters.name: human
required_parameters.description: A boolean that tells the api call to return human readable start and end time in the form YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS, as opposed to the unix timestamp. Default: false.

required_parameters.name: start
required_parameters.description: A string in the form of a unix timestamp, YYYY-mm-dd, YY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS or a time delta, where the time delta specified is start time prior to now. NOTE: start is only accepted in EST. Default: The start of today.

required_parameters.name: end
required_parameters.description: A string in the form of a unix timestamp, YYYY-mm-dd, YY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. NOTE: end is only accepted in EST. Default: The end of today.

required_parameters.name: limit
required_parameters.description: An integer or string that specifies the number of snapshots to return. e.g. 100 or time span from start to return snapshots for e.g. 10minutes, 3days, respectively. Default: the entire time span between start and end.

api_list.name: Historical Social Stats
api_list.description: Returns social activity summarized over the given timespan. You should use this call if you want to discover broad information about your data where we already did the work providing the max, min, average or median.

required_parameters.name: host
required_parameters.description: The domain of the site you would like to query represented as a string.

required_parameters.name: jsonp
required_parameters.description: The name of a function to wrap the return data in.

required_parameters.name: human
required_parameters.description: A boolean that tells the api call to return human readable start and end time in the form YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS, as opposed to the unix timestamp. Default: false.

required_parameters.name: start
required_parameters.description: A string in the form of a unix timestamp, YYYY-mm-dd, YY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS or a time delta, where the time delta specified is start time prior to now. NOTE: start is only accepted in EST. Default: 30 days ago.

required_parameters.name: end
required_parameters.description: A string in the form of a unix timestamp, YYYY-mm-dd, YY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. NOTE: end is only accepted in EST. Default: The end of today.

required_parameters.name: properties
required_parameters.description: The stat to apply to the data. Can be one or a comma separated list of max, min, avg, median. Default: max.

required_parameters.name: fields
required_parameters.description: One or a comma separated list of: tw_url_mentions: how many times your site's url is mentioned on Twitter in the given time span. tw_handle_mentions: the amount of times your Twitter handle is mentioned on Twitter in the given time span. fb_page_likes: the number of likes on your Facebook page in the given time span. fb_domain_activity: the number of times someone likes or shares a page on your website through the Facebook widget in the given time span. Default: tw_url_mentions,fb_domain_activity.

api_list.name: Historical Social Series
api_list.description: Returns series of the social activity where the default time span between each data point is 5 minutes. You should use this call if you want to see a more granular picture of your data.

required_parameters.name: jsonp
required_parameters.description: The name of a function to wrap the return data in.

required_parameters.name: human
required_parameters.description: A boolean that tells the api call to return human readable start and end time in the form YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS, as opposed to the unix timestamp. Default: false.

required_parameters.name: start
required_parameters.description: A string in the form of a unix timestamp, YYYY-mm-dd, YY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS or a time delta, where the time delta specified is start time prior to now. NOTE: start is only accepted in EST. Default: The start of today.

required_parameters.name: end
required_parameters.description: A string in the form of a unix timestamp, YYYY-mm-dd, YY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. NOTE: end is only accepted in EST. Default: The end of today.

required_parameters.name: limit
required_parameters.description: An integer or string that specifies the number of snapshots to return. e.g. 100 or time span from start to return snapshots for e.g. 10minutes, 3days, respectively. Default: the entire time span between start and end.

required_parameters.name: fields
required_parameters.description: One or a comma separated list of: tw_url_mentions: how many times your site's url is mentioned on Twitter in the given time span. tw_handle_mentions: the amount of times your Twitter handle is mentioned on Twitter in the given time span. fb_page_likes: the number of likes on your Facebook page in the given time span. fb_domain_activity: the number of times someone likes or shares a page on your website through the Facebook widget in the given time span. Default: tw_url_mentions,fb_domain_activity.

api_list.name: Historical Engagement Stats
api_list.description: Returns engaged seconds summarized over the given timespan. You should use this call if you want to discover broad information about your data where we already did the work providing the max or min.

required_parameters.name: jsonp
required_parameters.description: The name of a function to wrap the return data in.

required_parameters.name: human
required_parameters.description: A boolean that tells the api call to return human readable start and end time in the form YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS, as opposed to the unix timestamp. Default: false.

required_parameters.name: start
required_parameters.description: A string in the form of a unix timestamp, YYYY-mm-dd, YY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS or a time delta, where the time delta specified is start time prior to now. NOTE: start is only accepted in EST. Default: 30 days ago.

required_parameters.name: end
required_parameters.description: A string in the form of a unix timestamp, YYYY-mm-dd, YY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. NOTE: end is only accepted in EST. Default: The end of today.

required_parameters.name: properties
required_parameters.description: The stat to apply to the data. Can be one or a comma separated list of max, min. Default: max.

api_list.name: Historical Traffic Series
api_list.description: Returns series of the traffic sources and/or page load time where the default time span of each data point is 5 minutes. You should use this call if you want to see a more granular picture of your data.

required_parameters.name: host
required_parameters.description: The domain of the site you would like to query represented as a string.

required_parameters.name: jsonp
required_parameters.description: The name of a function to wrap the return data in.

required_parameters.name: human
required_parameters.description: A boolean that tells the api call to return human readable start and end time in the form YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS, as opposed to the unix timestamp. Default: false.

required_parameters.name: start
required_parameters.description: A string in the form of a unix timestamp, YYYY-mm-dd, YY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS or a time delta, where the time delta specified is start time prior to now. NOTE: start is only accepted in EST. Default: The start of today.

required_parameters.name: end
required_parameters.description: A string in the form of a unix timestamp, YYYY-mm-dd, YY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. NOTE: end is only accepted in EST. Default: The end of today.

required_parameters.name: limit
required_parameters.description: An integer or string that specifies the number of snapshots to return. e.g. 100 or time span from start to return snapshots for e.g. 10minutes, 3days, respectively. Default: the entire time span between start and end.

required_parameters.name: fields
required_parameters.description: One or a comma separated list of: return: the number of returning visitors. new: the number of new visitors. people: the number of people on the domain. read: the number of people reading on the domain. domload: the DOM load time. engaged_time_avg: the average enagaged time. write: the number of people writing on the domain. idle: the number of people idle on the domain. internal: the number of people coming from an internal referrer. social: the number of people coming from social services. Default: people.

api_list.name: Live Quick Stats v3
api_list.description: Returns an overview summary of the people on your domain right now. The number of people on a page, reading, writing, idle, etc... This call returns real-time data.

required_parameters.name: host
required_parameters.description: The domain of the site you would like to query represented as a string.

required_parameters.name: jsonp
required_parameters.description: The name of a function to wrap the return data in.

required_parameters.name: path
required_parameters.description: A specific path. If not given, data is from all paths. e.g. the path of http://chartbeat.com/signup/ is /signup/.

api_list.name: Live Top Pages v3
api_list.description: Returns a list of pages, ordered by which ones have most visitors right now. This call returns real-time data.

required_parameters.name: host
required_parameters.description: The domain of the site you would like to query represented as a string.

required_parameters.name: jsonp
required_parameters.description: The name of a function to wrap the return data in/

required_parameters.name: limit
required_parameters.description: limit		 The max number of pages to return. Default: 10.

api_list.name: Live Referrers v3
api_list.description: Returns a list of referrers for the domain.

required_parameters.name: host
required_parameters.description: The domain of the site you would like to query represented as a string.

required_parameters.name: jsonp
required_parameters.description: The name of a function to wrap the return data in.

required_parameters.name: path
required_parameters.description: A specific path. If not given, data is from all paths. e.g. the path of http://chartbeat.com/signup/ is /signup/.

required_parameters.name: limit
required_parameters.description: The max number of referrers to return. Default: 10.

api_list.name: Live Recent v3
api_list.description: Returns information about the most recent visitors to a given host. This call returns real-time data.

required_parameters.name: path
required_parameters.description: A specific path. If not given, data is from all paths. e.g. the path of http://chartbeat.com/signup/ is /signup/.

required_parameters.name: host
required_parameters.description: The domain of the site you would like to query represented as a string.

required_parameters.name: jsonp
required_parameters.description: The name of a function to wrap the return data in.

required_parameters.name: limit
required_parameters.description: The max number of recent visitors to return. Default: 50.

api_list.name: Historical Traffic Stats
api_list.description: Returns traffic sources and/or page load time summarized over the given timespan. You should use this call if you want to discover broad information about your data where we already did the work providing the max or min.

required_parameters.name: jsonp
required_parameters.description: The name of a function to wrap the return data in.

required_parameters.name: human
required_parameters.description: A boolean that tells the api call to return human readable start and end time in the form YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS, as opposed to the unix timestamp. Default: false.

required_parameters.name: end
required_parameters.description: A string in the form of a unix timestamp, YYYY-mm-dd, YY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. NOTE: end is only accepted in EST. Default: The end of today.

required_parameters.name: properties
required_parameters.description: The stat to apply to the data. Can be one or a comma separated list of max, min. Default: max.

required_parameters.name: fields
required_parameters.description: One or a comma separated list of: return: the number of returning visitors. new: the number of new visitors. people: the number of people on the domain. read: the number of people reading on the domain. domload: the DOM load time. engaged_time_avg: the average enagaged time. write: the number of people writing on the domain. idle: the number of people idle on the domain. internal: the number of people coming from an internal referrer. social: the number of people coming from social services. Default: people.
